image.altText: Snowtown accomplice Mark Ray Haydon in a car being escorted from court.

props.synopsis: The head of South Australia's parole board says Snowtown accomplice Mark Haydon has been released after serving a 25-year jail sentence. The South Australian government says he will reside at the Adelaide Pre-Release Centre as a condition of his parole.

title.children: Snowtown 'bodies-in-the-barrels' accomplice Mark Haydon released from prison

image.altText: A screenshot of CCTV vision.

props.synopsis: Geoscience Australia says the quake hit an area north-east of the town just after 4pm at a depth of 1 kilometre and could be felt in Adelaide, about 200 kilometres south of the town.

title.children: 'Violent' magnitude-4.1 earthquake strikes Jamestown in South Australia's Mid North

image.altText: Paramedics stand with stretches near vehicles on a road.

props.synopsis: Hospitals prepare for mass casualty events. At Sydney's St Vincent's hospital, they had to enact that plan on Saturday — this is how they handled the situation.

title.children: Repeated resuscitation was needed to keep Bondi stabbing victims alive

image.altText: Air Force F-35A Lightning

props.synopsis: Plans to purchase additional Joint Strike Fighter aircraft are being halted under sweeping defence changes unveiled by the Albanese government that would see Australia’s overall military budget almost double within a decade.

title.children: Joint Strike Fighter plans face axe under government defence reprioritisation

image.altText: Gavin Webb holds a bass while sitting on stage.

props.synopsis: One of the founding members of Australian rock band The Masters Apprentices, Gavin Webb, has died aged 77 after a six-year battle with cancer.

title.children: Founding member of The Masters Apprentices Gavin Webb dies

image.altText: Stephen Docoza poses for a photo.

props.synopsis: The family of a man found dead in Adelaide's CBD 40 years ago speaks out ahead of the release of one of the men convicted of his murder. Last month, Bromley, who has always maintained his innocence, was granted parole by the SA Parole Board.

title.children: Stephen Docoza's family speak out ahead of Derek Bromley's release

image.altText: A young man poses for a photo on a cliff face, with mountains behind him.

props.synopsis: University student Benjamin Cohen was falsely accused of being the stabber behind the Bondi Junction Westfield attack on Saturday, following misinformation that was spread online.

title.children: Man wrongly identified as Bondi Junction stabber pursues defamation case against Network Seven

image.altText: A man in a colourful shirt plays the melodica

props.synopsis: Queensland Conservatorium graduate and Bluey composer Joff Bush wins two Queensland Music Awards for his work on the show, with Jem Cassar-Daley, Cub Sport and James Blundell also taking home honours.

title.children: Bluey composer wins double music gongs for whimsical work on cartoon soundtrack

image.altText: A father and two sons smile in front of a mountain.

props.synopsis: Thomas Kelly's parents have suffered more heartbreak than most. Now, with their son's killer to be released in a matter of days, they say they were lied to by Corrective Services NSW ahead of Kieran Loveridge's parole.

title.children: 'He will reoffend': Thomas Kelly's family only learned Kieran Loveridge was still violent at his parole hearing

image.altText: A composite image of a man holding knife and man with surfboard

props.synopsis: A month ago, Joel Cauchi's parents were relieved to see a text message showing him enjoying life at the beach. Next time they saw him it was on national television as he attacked people in a Sydney shopping centre.

title.children: Five weeks ago, Joel Cauchi sent his parents a message from a beach. The next time they saw him was on the news

image.altText: A Port Adelaide AFL footballer holds the ball in both hands as he runs and looks downfield.

props.synopsis: After being banned for a homophobic slur against an opponent, Port Adelaide's Jeremy Finlayson says his comments on a since-edited podcast, venting frustration, were aimed at himself.

title.children: Port Adelaide's Finlayson says homophobic slur ban comments were misconstrued

image.altText: A man sitting looking at flowers in a tribute at Bondi Junction shopping centre.

props.synopsis: The shopping mall at the centre of Saturday's fatal stabbings in Sydney will reopen tomorrow for a community reflection day, before resuming normal trading hours on Friday.

title.children: Bondi Junction mall to reopen tomorrow for community reflection after fatal stabbing attack

image.altText: A blurred imagine of two young people sitting together

props.synopsis: A family is in mourning following the death by suicide of a 10-year-old boy who was under the WA government's care.WARNING: This story contains distressing content.

title.children: Family in mourning after 10-year-old boy dies by suicide while under the WA government's care

image.altText: Soldiers in camouflage parade holding guns

props.synopsis: Britain's foreign minister says it is clear that Israel is making a decision to act against Iran for its unprecedented strike on its territory.

title.children: Israel 'making a decision to act' against Iran, as Iran warns of 'fierce and severe response'

image.altText: Illustration of NASA's Ingenuity helicopter with Perseverance in background

props.synopsis: The helicopter, called Ingenuity, has transmitted its final message to Earth and will now serve as an immobile data-gathering unit on the red planet's surface, the space agency says.

title.children: NASA's Ingenuity helicopter sends last message from Mars to Earth

image.altText: An image of Brittany Higgins next to an image of Bruce Lehrmann.

props.synopsis: Justice Michael Lee leaned in to the Shakespearean tragedy of Bruce Lehrmann's case and with the narrative muscularity of a literary thriller showed simplicity and complexity need not be enemies. As his judgment took form it became clear he had an altogether more useful verdict in mind.

title.children: The public battle between 'Team Higgins' and 'Team Lehrmann' revealed the most frightening trap of tribalism

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann outside the ACT Supreme Court with a serious expression, wearing glasses and a tie. He has a beard.

props.synopsis: What happened between Bruce Lehrmann and Brittany Higgins in a ministerial suite at Parliament House in March 2019 has triggered at least a dozen avenues of legal action so far — and the costs of all this litigation are set to be many millions.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann's costs in failed defamation case set to be astronomically high

image.altText: Mollie O'Callaghan at the 2024 swimming championships

props.synopsis: Mollie O'Callaghan may have beaten the likes of Olympic champion Emma McKeon, Meg Harris and Shayna Jack to the 100m freestyle title at the Australian championships, but she is hungry for more.

title.children: 'I would have liked faster': O'Callaghan unsatisfied despite claiming Australian 100m freestyle title

image.altText: A truck driving next to a sign for a bypass around Penola

props.synopsis: It has been four years since a contentious bypass directed trucks away from Penola, opening just before COVID-19 border restrictions in a double whammy that led to lost trade for businesses, but locals say the town is bouncing back.

title.children: Bypass takes trucks off Penola's main street but at what cost?

image.altText: A woman smiles and poses for a photo that has been overlayed with a sepia filter, adjusting the colour to give it a yellow tone

props.synopsis: Rachael Dixon, a 53-year-old Melbourne woman, died after ingesting a drink at a regional Victorian wellness centre that was made with mushrooms. Here's what we know.

title.children: Operator of Victorian wellness centre speaks after death of Melbourne woman

image.altText: Horse in a stable.

props.synopsis: The Wagga Wagga City Council says the horses appear to have been slaughtered over a long period of time, with some killed "relatively recently".

title.children: More than 500 butchered horses found at property allegedly operating as illegal knackery

image.altText: An elderly couple wearing masks walk on the Bondi beach boardwalk.

props.synopsis: Fresh data from the Bureau of Statistics Time Use Survey provides a snapshot of how different generations spent their leisure and recreation time during 2020-21.

title.children: What did you do with all your free time during COVID? Data shows how each generation compared

image.altText: woman leaning against a gate

props.synopsis: Jyles and Rainey Lebler say their mother wouldn't willingly leave them behind as they beg for information on the woman who was last seen checking out of a Gold Coast clinic in 1995.

title.children: Sons fight back tears in desperate plea for information on mum who disappeared from Gold Coast

image.altText: A green comet streaking through a star studded sky

props.synopsis: Australians will be able to see comet 12P/Pons-Brooks aka the 'Devil Comet' this week even without a telescope or binoculars. Here's how to spot it and snap a photo.

title.children: Want to see the 'Devil Comet' at its brightest? If you miss it, you’ll have to wait another 71 years

image.altText: A graphic of John Coast and Graham Quirk in front of Olympic rings.

props.synopsis: John Coates and Graham Quirk have given evidence at a Senate inquiry into Brisbane 2032, as a bill is tabled to set up an independent delivery authority to operate at arm's length from the government.

title.children: Independent Games authority a step closer as Senate inquiry drills down into planning disputes

image.altText: Hero Image for story

props.synopsis: From a love letter to Australia's flora and fauna to a downright kitschy get-up, here's what our Olympians have worn to opening ceremonies over the years.

title.children: The Paris 2024 opening ceremony uniforms have been unveiled. Here's how Team Australia's look has evolved

image.altText: Anthony Albanese holds up a dollar coin while standing in the House of Representatives

props.synopsis: The good news is there's likely to be some change to Australia's HELP scheme, and we're likely to hear about it soon, in the lead-up to the May budget. The bad news for borrowers is it won't be debt relief of the kind Biden is offering.

title.children: Albanese's budget will likely include changes to student debt. Here's what that could look like

image.altText: A plane on a runway with high water around it

props.synopsis: Dubai's major international airport diverts scores of incoming flights as heavy rains flood the United Arab Emirates after leaving 20 dead in the region.

title.children: 'I like to play in the rain but this scares me': Storms disrupt flights in Dubai after killing 20 in region

image.altText: A man looks at stock prices through the window of the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market has finished slightly in the red as traders await further indications about the likely path of interest rates and the conflict in the Middle East. See how the day unfolded on our business news blog.

title.children: ASX ends lower amid geopolitical, interest rate uncertainty — as it happened

image.altText: A man looks at a computer screen. He is wearing glasses.

props.synopsis: Andrew Ryder was recovering from a $10,000 fraud attack when his Optus account was hacked a second time.

title.children: Optus customer who lost $10,000 from bank will leave telco after second fraud attack

image.altText: A happy smiling woman wearing glasses and a brightly coloured scarf over a dark blouse.

props.synopsis: Liberal senator Linda Reynolds has responded to the Federal Court's judgement in the defamation case brought by Bruce Lehrmann against Network 10 and Lisa Wilkinson, saying she is beyond pleased the court "has set the record straight" about her treatment of Brittany Higgins.

title.children: Linda Reynolds says Lehrmann defamation judgement 'set record straight' on claims of cover-up

image.altText: Three faces from the community

props.synopsis: For many in Sydney's Assyrian community, the images of violence at the Christ The Good Shepherd Church on Monday evening brought flashbacks of war.

title.children: 'It's like an exposed nerve': Assyrians express raw emotions following Sydney stabbing and riot

image.altText: A woman sits on a couch with two dogs and a magpie.

props.synopsis: After more than six weeks apart, the Insta-famous magpie and its best dog friends are back together at home on the Gold Coast — singing and sunning themselves like old times.

title.children: Molly the magpie singing with joy as video of long-awaited reunion with canine best friend released

props.synopsis: The AFP Victim Identification Team are often parents themselves, tasked with solving some of the most grim and shocking crimes humans commit. For them, disconnecting from work is a necessity.

title.children: Sergeant Kate Laidler trained to be a PE teacher. She never imagined spending her work days tracking down predators

image.altText: People in swimming gear standing on the edge of a sinkhole full of water.

props.synopsis: Little Blue Lake attracts thousands of tourists and cave divers from across the globe, but has no toilet facilities. Appalled residents say it's high time something is done to prevent people from relieving themselves in the water and car park at the site.

title.children: Anger and disgust as human poo piles up in and around iconic SA swimming hole
